title: The opaque department tasked with protecting Australia's democracy facing allegations of a toxic culture
description: It's the government department tasked with protecting Australia's democracy, yet within it bubble accusations of a toxic culture, the silencing of dissent and the routine cover-up of problems. - www.abc.net.au
content: In short: The federal Department of Parliamentary Services is facing allegations of a toxic culture that silences dissent and covers up problems. Critics say the department has largely been overlooked in the reckoning that happened at Parliament House in recent years. It comes amid reports of a relationship between the two top public servants within the department. It's the government department tasked with protecting Australia's democracy, yet within it bubbles accusations of a toxic culture, the silencing of dissent and the routine cover-up of problems. The department governs Parliament House but some of its staff are so suspicious and fearful of those running it, they regard it as a workplace where "the walls have eyes". The ABC has spent months speaking to public servants — past and present — plus politicians and their staff from both sides of the political aisle, as well as people who have worked across a range of professions at Parliament House, all of whom would only speak under the condition of anonymity. Repeatedly and without prompting the word "toxic" was offered about the Department of Parliamentary Services (DPS). And yet efforts to scrutinise its operations, its management and practices are practically impossible — by design. That's because DPS has been granted extraordinary and unique isolation from standard methods of scrutiny — and by someone who once promised to meet the public's higher expectations. The department is exempt from Freedom of Information laws — a change Anthony Albanese, as the then leader of the House of Representatives, introduced as an "interim measure" more than a decade ago. Rob Stefanic gave evidence about Ms Saunders to senators in February but didn't disclose their relationship. ( AAP: Mick Tsikas ) To its critics, DPS has largely been overlooked in the reckoning that happened at Parliament House in recent years, where a spotlight has been shone on the culture and treatment of staff following Brittany Higgins's... Brett Worthington

title: Nicki Minaj announces new date for postponed Co-op Live arena gig
description: The rapper and singer had to postpone the performance after her arrest in the Netherlands on Saturday.
content: The rapper and singer, 41, had to be reschedule the gig after her arrest in the Netherlands on Saturday. “OK guys, I was JUST RE-ADVISED that we actually CAN NOT do any other date for the make up #gagcityMANCHESTER date besides JUNE 3rd,” she said on X. “So JUNE 3rd is the new official date for all ticket holders who originally had tickets to the MAY 25th #Manchester show. OK guys, I was JUST RE-ADVISED that we actually CAN NOT do any other date for the make up #gagcityMANCHESTER date besides JUNE 3rd. So JUNE 3rd is the new official date for all ticket holders who originally had tickets to the MAY 25th #Manchester show. I apologize for all the... — Nicki Minaj (@NICKIMINAJ) May 27, 2024 “I apologise for all the inconvenience this has caused. I really hope you can make the #JUNE3rd show. It’ll be really special. Ticketmaster will contact you to advise officially.” Minaj said she spent around six hours in custody at Amsterdam’s Schiphol Airport on Saturday before being able to fly to the UK. Fans were let into the newly-opened Manchester venue at around 7pm on Saturday for her show, before promoter Live Nation announced at around 9.40pm that it was to be postponed. Dutch police said a woman aged 41 was arrested on Saturday after allegedly trying to take what it described as “soft drugs” from Schiphol Airport to another country. A later update from the force said it had released the “suspect and she can now move on” after paying a fine. A post shared by Barbie (@nickiminaj) It marked the latest postponed gig at the Co-op Live arena which has been plagued with issues since trying to open in April. Minaj had praised fans for being a “class act” during the last-minute postponement, and invited them to her hotel in the centre of Manchester before speaking to the crowds outside. The music star, who is known for the songs Starships, Super Bass and Anaconda, livestreamed her arrest on social media and claimed drugs found in her luggage did not belong to her. She performed at Birmingham’s Resorts World Arena on Sunday.

title: Muscat Municipal Council to give facelift to Muttrah corniche
keywords: bilarab bin haitham award for architectural design
sayyid saud bin hilal al busaidi
creator: Mohammad
description: Muttrah, the landmark tourist attraction in Muscat, will soon undergo major transformation with the addition of an iconic Muttrah Square Project, a multi-storey car parking and several cafés around the neighbourhood
content: Muttrah, the landmark tourist attraction in Muscat, will soon undergo major transformation with the addition of an iconic Muttrah Square Project, a multi-storey car parking and several cafés around the neighbourhood. The Municipal Council of Muscat on Monday held its fifth meeting of the year, chaired by Sayyid Saud bin Hilal al Busaidi, Governor of Muscat, in the presence of Ahmed al Humaidi, Chairman of Muscat Municipality. On the sidelines of the meeting, Humaidi said, “The municipality is finalising detailed maps for the development of Muttrah, which includes the enhancement of corniche and the establishment of cafés and restaurants in the residential neighbourhoods.” Additionally, the municipality will commence the implementation of the Muttrah Square Project during the third quarter of this year, he informed. “A tender has also been issued for the construction of a multi-storey car park in Muttrah to alleviate traffic congestion.” Muttrah Square Project involves construction of an iconic bridge in the shape of an arch looming over the middle of the square by the sea, which had won the first edition of the Bilarab bin Haitham Award for Architectural Design. Inspired by the sword of Imam al Salt bin Malik al Kharusi, the iconic structure will offer a view of all the famous landmarks of Muttrah. The arched bridge will have a mixed-use plaza, a dancing fountain, retail stores and cafés. During the meeting, the council reviewed the Omran Group’s statement regarding the Sultan Qaboos Port waterfront development project. Omran is leading the redevelopment of the area, projected to be crucial in transforming Muttrah into a premier tourist destination with the highest international standards. The national project aligns with Oman Vision 2040 and the National Tourism Strategy that seek to enhance efforts to create unique tourist destinations and experiences. The multi-use tourism project will adhere to considerations set by the Oman Investment Authority, ensuring it adds value without disrupting the port’s location, historical, and architectural heritage.

title: Died on this day: Ezzard Charles
creator: Diego Morilla
content: Now that we have a “small heavyweight” as a champ, it may be time to remember one of the best of that bunch. The great Ezzard Charles died on a day like today in 1975. Born in Lawrenceville, Georgia in 1921, Charles followed the path of many other African-Americans in those years, going from the deep south to the industrial north and relocating to Cincinnati, Ohio at a young age. He was an outstanding amateur who won the Chicago Golden Gloves and the national AAU middleweight championship after a 42-0 blitzkrieg of a campaign, and then jumped to the pros in March 1940 with a third-round knockout over Melody Johnson at 160 pounds. The “Cincinnati Cobra” outgrew the division ten fights into his career, but continued fighting in the 160-165-pound range as a light-heavyweight for years, often being outweighed by as much as 15 pounds by his foes. In spite of scoring some of his most extraordinary wins at 175, Charles never received the opportunity of fighting for the world title at that division, in which he is nevertheless considered perhaps the finest pure boxer ever. Wins over the likes of Archie Moore, Charley Burley, Joey Maxim, Jimmy Bivins, Lloyd Marshall and many others were not enough for him to gain access to the coveted world title clash. And after the death of Sam Baroudi in 1948 after being stopped by him, Charles hit rock bottom and considered quitting boxing altogether. But ten fights later, and already fighting as a small heavyweight, Charles received the opportunity to face Jersey Joe Walcott for the vacant NBA heavyweight belt left behind by Joe Louis. In a beautiful display of footwork, skills, wit and power, Charles became the heavyweight champion of the world on June 22, 1949, and went on to make eight defenses of his belt against the likes of Walcott (rematch), Maxim, Gus Lesnevich, a badly faded Joe Louis, and others. Finally, in 1951, his third bout against Walcott ended with Charles losing his belt after being stopped in seven round s. He would lose again to Walcott in a rematch, but he continued fighting for eight more years, defeating Cesar Brion, Rex Layne and Bob Satterfield before losing back-to-back title bouts against Rocky Marciano in 1954 . He would amass a 10-13 record after those two bouts in what was the last stretch of his career before calling it quits in 1959. After his ring days were over, he worked as a wrestler and did several menial jobs before falling victim to Lou Gehrig’s Disease and becoming wheelchair-bound in the last years of his life. Charles died in 1975. He had been named The Ring’s Fighter of the Year in 1949 and 1950, and was inducted into the International Boxing Hall of Fame in the inaugural class of 1990. Diego M. Morilla has written for The Ring since 2013. He has also written for HBO.com, ESPN.com and many other magazines, websites, newspapers and outlets since 1993. He is a full member of the Boxing Writers Association of America and an elector for the International Boxing Hall of Fame. He has won two first-place awards in the BWAA’s annual writing contest, and he is the moderator of The Ring’s Women’s Ratings Panel. He served as copy editor for the second era of The Ring en Español (2018-2020) and is currently a writer and editor for RingTV.com. Follow @MorillaBoxing Thanks for signing up! Check your inbox or spam folder to confirm your subscription.

title: Osun: Esa-Oke central union donates generator to community maternity centre
creator: Adeolu Adeyemo
description: Tribune OnlineOsun: Esa-Oke central union donates generator to community maternity centreThe executives of Esa-Oke Central Union in Osun State on Monday donated a generating set to the town maternity centre. The union also commissioned a renovated toilet for market women and cleared an eight-kilometre abandoned Imesi to Esa-Oke road. Speaking during the inauguration and swearing-in ceremony of executives, the union chairman, Gbamigboye Aremu said the [...]Osun: Esa-Oke central union donates generator to community maternity centreTribune Online
content: The executives of Esa-Oke Central Union in Osun State on Monday donated a generating set to the town maternity centre. The union also commissioned a renovated toilet for market women and cleared an eight-kilometre abandoned Imesi to Esa-Oke road. Speaking during the inauguration and swearing-in ceremony of executives, the union chairman, Gbamigboye Aremu said the gesture was to ease the affairs of the residents of the town. He said, “The reason why we donated the generating set was due to the complaint by those working in the maternity centre that they don’t usually get light during the delivery of pregnant women. “After the complaints, we the executives of the union tasked ourselves and get the generator for the maternity to aid their service delivery. “Also, the leadership of the market women came to us that they needed us to renovate their toilets for convenience which we also do. “We also cleared the bushy portion of Imesi to Esa-Oke road which has been abandoned by road users. Motorists are scared to pass the road for fear of being kidnapped but now, we have cleared the road and expanded it and our people can make use of it now.” Aremu appealed to the leadership of the community maternity centre and market to make proper use of the donated equipment and toilet. “I want to appeal to the beneficiaries to make proper use of the donated equipment. We have done our part and we are still aiming to do more but they also have to maintain those things judiciously .” The monarch of the town, Adeyemi Adediran, appreciated the union for their kind gesture, calling on sons and daughters of the community to always give back to their community. ALSO READ: CODE trains Osun stakeholders to investigate govt projects

title: Motorists in Oman can view photos of their traffic violations on app
keywords: brigadier nasser bin musallam al ruzaiqi
creator: Mohammad
description: The Royal Oman Police (ROP) has introduced a new feature in its mobile app that allows motorists to view images of their traffic violations
content: The Royal Oman Police (ROP) has introduced a new feature in its mobile app that allows motorists to view images of their traffic violations. This announcement was made at the opening of the COMEX Show on Monday. During the exhibition, Brigadier Nasser bin Musallam al Ruzaiqi, Director General of Information Technology at ROP, explained that the police department launched several comprehensive new services, including renewal of vehicle registrations through self-service machines, e-linking of the Supreme Judicial Council for marriage registrations and payment of traffic fines using payment portals such as Thawani and Tasdeed. The new service also includes reprinting of lost vehicle licences via self-service kioks after submitting the request through the ROP app, he added. “The Royal Oman Police is making great efforts to contribute to achieving the objectives of Oman Vision 2040 by introducing innovative initiatives, preparing thoughtful plans, qualifying and training human cadres, and harnessing available resources,” Brigadier Ruzaiqi elaborated. He stressed the continued modernisation and development of ROP’s technical system using the latest technological tools and means, such as artificial intelligence. In this context, Brigadier Ruzaiqi added that the ROP mobile app provides a comprehensive platform for inquiry and payment of local or Gulf traffic and municipal fines whether of an individual or a company. “Users can download violation reports, search by service category and period, and view e-payment history. The app enables users to check violations associated with a specific vehicle, ensuring the owner’s data matches with the vehicle’s data.”

title: Timberwolves ‘Very Likely’ to Keep Core Together
creator: Ezra Greenman, Minnesota Sports Fan
description: The Minnesota Timberwolves find themselves in a tough spot, trailing 0-3 going into game four vs the Dallas Mavericks in the Western Conference Finals.
content: The Minnesota Timberwolves find themselves in a tough spot, trailing 0-3 going into game four vs the Dallas Mavericks in the Western Conference Finals. With elimination looming, conversations are already shifting towards what next season might hold for this roster. NBA insider, Evan Sidery (Forbes Sports, Sporting News) , shared some interesting insights about the Timberwolves’ plans this offseason, a topic that has been in the back of many minds, given the luxury tax penalties that loom large over the organization. Minnesota Timberwolves running it back in 2024-25? Anthony Edwards and Jaden McDaniels’ new contracts both kick in next season, not to mention a $14 million raise for Karl-Anthony Towns. In total, the Wolves are one of only two teams already projected into the 2nd apron of the league’s luxury tax system, which will cost a projected $50 million tax payment next year. That’s why many are questioning whether or not the Wolves could trade Karl-Anthony Towns and blow up their big three . Some even suggested that Jaden McDaniels could be on the trade block too . But in a somewhat convoluted Twitter post Monday, Sidery tried to put Minnesota Timberwolves fans at ease, writing that the Timberwolves are “very likely to run it back next season”. The Timberwolves will be paying $172.4 million to five players next season: Karl-Anthony Towns = $49.3 million Rudy Gobert = $43.9 million Anthony Edwards = $42.3 million Jaden McDaniels = $22.9 million Naz Reid = $14.0 million Minnesota’s ongoing ownership war featuring Glen... pic.twitter.com/ujFTO0vKiX Minnesota’s ongoing ownership war featuring Glen Taylor vs. Alex Rodriguez and Marc Lore is another interesting wrinkle to their long-term roster decisions. Minnesota will very likely run it back next season, but Rudy Gobert becomes extension-eligible this offseason. If the Timberwolves fork over a lucrative extension to Gobert, what does the immediate future hold for Towns? As we get ready to enter the offseason, there are plenty of uncertainties swirling around the Timberwolves organization. The biggest immediate question surrounds their ability to do the impossible and turn this series around. Then there’s the Tim Connelly opt out , and the ongoing ownership war ... As fans eagerly await answers, it’s clear that significant decisions lie ahead that will shape the trajectory of the franchise. Keeping the core team intact would be an expensive way to show fans that the organization is willing to invest in the club, no matter whose name is on it when this all shakes out. This article first appeared on Minnesota Sports Fan and was syndicated with permission.

title: BoTT Collaborates With Meguru Yamaguchi in New Capsule Collection
creator: info@hypebeast.com (Hypebeast)
description: Birth of The Teenager (BoTT) has collaborated with Japanese-born, New York-based artist Meguru Yamaguchi on a limited capsule collection. Founded in 2019 by fellow Japanese artist TEITO, BoTT produces timeless streetwear staples using premium materials and playful graphics, which in the past has included collaborations with Umbro, TTTMSW and Reebok. Yamaguchi, who runs the Brooklyn-based studio and collective GOLD WOOD ARTWORKS, is known for creating dynamic abstract paintings that appear like an explosion of paint frozen in time. Notably inspired by the expressive works of Vincent Van Gogh and Kazuo Shiraga, over the past decade Yamaguchi has developed an aesthetic that is less about representation, and more an emphasis on the feeling of painting, as he super-sizes his brushstrokes into three-dimensional canvases and sculptures.BoTT and Yamaguchi created a line of simple branded tees, pillows and an ash tray bearing both the label's acronym overlaid on Yamaguchi's signature blue, black and white abstracted marks. Shop the full collection online.Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast

title: Biden Honors America’s Fallen Soldiers in Memorial Day Address
creator: Emel Akan
description: He urged Americans 'to remember and honor the sacrifice of the hundreds of thousands of women and men who have given their lives to this nation.'
content: President Joe Biden on May 27 paid tribute to fallen service members during his Memorial Day speech at Arlington National Cemetery in Arlington, Virginia, stating that they had “fought for a future grounded in freedom, democracy, opportunity, and equality.” “We gathered at this sacred place, at this solemn moment, to remember and honor the sacrifice of the hundreds of thousands of women and men who have given their lives to this nation,” he said to begin his remarks. “Each one bound by common commitment, not to a place, not to a person, not to a president, but to an idea, unlike any idea in human history, the idea of the United States of America.” Memorial Day was officially proclaimed in 1868 to honor Union and Confederate soldiers during the Civil War. After World War I, it was expanded to commemorate all those who died in military service. During his remarks, President Biden also made veiled criticisms of his rival, former President Donald Trump, as he has done in recent days. “Our democracy is more than just a system of government. It’s the very soul of America. It’s how we’ve been able to constantly adapt to the centuries,” the president said. “And just as our fallen heroes have kept the ultimate faith with our country and our democracy, we must keep faith with them,” he added. President Biden also remembered his son Beau, a veteran and former federal prosecutor, who died of cancer in 2015. “This week marks nine years since I lost my son, Beau. ... He didn’t perish on the battlefield. He was a cancer victim from a consequence of being in the Army in Iraq for a year next to a burn pit,” he said. President Biden and his campaign recently have stepped up their efforts to win veterans who traditionally back Republicans. “Since I took office, I’ve signed over 30 bipartisan laws supporting servicemen, veterans and their families, caregivers, and survivors,” the president said at the ceremony. He launched a series of events last week aimed at focusing on veterans and military members. On May 21, he delivered a speech in New Hampshire, marking a milestone for the PACT Act, a bipartisan law he signed two years ago to expand health care and benefits for veterans exposed to burn pits and other toxic substances. The President announced that Veteran Affairs has already approved more than one million claims under the PACT Act. President Biden also delivered a commencement address on May 25 at the U.S. Military Academy’s graduation ceremony at West Point in upstate New York. The president delivered the address to nearly 1,000 cadets graduating from the 222-year-old academy who have joined the ranks of the U.S. Army as officers. He urged graduates to keep fast to the values they learned at West Point and, most importantly, their oath. “On your very first day at West Point, you raised your right hands and took an oath—not to a political party, not to a president, but to the Constitution of the United States of America—against all enemies, foreign and domestic,” President Biden said. The 156th National Memorial Day ceremony began with the traditional wreath-laying. President Biden was accompanied by Vice President Kamala Harris and Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin. “Our arms and technology are the envy of the world. But in the end, America’s greatest strategic asset will always be our people,” Mr. Austin said during a speech at the ceremony. “So, let us always remember our fallen heroes must always strive to defend the democracy for which they fought and died.”

title: Netanyahu Admits Strike on Rafah Was a 'Tragic Mistake' After Massive Backlash for Brutal Attack
creator: Jack Davis
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called the bombing of a Palestinian camp in Rafah a “tragic mistake” amid condemnation for the deaths of an estimated 45 Palestinians in the incident. [...]The post Netanyahu Admits Strike on Rafah Was a 'Tragic Mistake' After Massive Backlash for Brutal Attack appeared first on The Western Journal.
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called the bombing of a Palestinian camp in Rafah a “tragic mistake” amid condemnation for the deaths of an estimated 45 Palestinians in the incident. “Despite our utmost efforts not to harm innocent civilians, last night, there was a tragic mistake,” Netanyahu said, according to . “We are investigating the incident and will obtain a conclusion because this is our policy.” Despite the response, Israel still felt the brunt of . “There are no safe areas in Rafah for Palestinian civilians,” French President Emmanuel Macron said, according to . He called for “full respect for international law and an immediate ceasefire.” The Times quoted the Hamas-controlled Gaza Health Ministry as saying 45 people were killed and 240 people were wounded. The Biden administration called images of the strike “devastating,” according to the . “Israel has a right to go after Hamas, and we understand this strike killed two senior Hamas terrorists who are responsible for attacks against Israeli civilians, but, as we’ve been clear, Israel must take every precaution possible to protect civilians,” a National Security Council representative said. “We are actively engaging the IDF and partners on the ground to assess what happened,” the spokesperson adds. The Israeli airstrike in southern Gaza’s Rafah overnight, targeting two senior Hamas officials but also reportedly killing dozens of Palestinian civilians, will be probed by the top-tier General Staff Fact-Finding Assessment Mechanism, the military announces. The mechanism is an... — Emanuel (Mannie) Fabian (@manniefabian) Despite offering an apology for the mistake in Rafah, said Israel will not stop fighting, according to the . “Those who say they are not ready to stand up to the pressure, raise the flag of defeat; I won’t raise any such flag, I will keep fighting until the flag of victory is raised,” he said. “I don’t intend to end the war before every goal has been achieved. If we give in, the massacre will return. If we give in, we will give a huge win to terror, to Iran,” he said. While saying the deaths of civilians was a mistake, Netanyahu said, “For us it’s a tragedy, for Hamas it’s a strategy.” On Sunday, sent rockets from Rafah into central Israel, without causing any injuries, according to AP. It was also reported that an Egyptian soldier was killed along the border with Gaza, but the circumstances of the incident were unclear Monday. We are committed to truth and accuracy in all of our journalism.

title: Blue Kumuls, FC Genesis settle for 1-1 draw in fiery match-up
creator: pcAdminPNG
description: THE Blue Kumuls and FC Genesis clashed in a thrilling encounter that showcased the best of their skills, with both teams refusing to yield in the Port Moresby soccer association men's premier division match on Saturday.The post Blue Kumuls, FC Genesis settle for 1-1 draw in fiery match-up appeared first on Post Courier.
content: THE Blue Kumuls and FC Genesis clashed in a thrilling encounter that showcased the best of their skills, with both teams refusing to yield in the Port Moresby soccer association men’s premier division match on Saturday. In the end, they had to settle for a hard-fought draw, leaving both sets of fans eagerly anticipating their next showdown. Both teams wasted no time when five minutes from kickoff, Blue Kumuls were awarded a free kick just outside the penalty box. Hans Tapio (15) unleashed a powerful shot that ricocheted off the crossbar. After that, Genesis upped the ante, launching a sustained attack that yielded two successive corner kicks. Unfortunately, they couldn’t capitalise on the opportunities. Play continued in Genesis half of the field with Blue Kumuls midfield team of Steven Inia and Tapio probing the Genesis defence when a sneak pass found Jordan Kaven (11) who shot from within the box right on the 18th minute for Blue Kumuls to lead 1-0. A scramble in the Blue Kumul’s penalty box ten minutes later found Genesis number 16 Ezekiel Vela with a loose ball that he calmly pushed past keeper Baniau to level the scores at 1-1. The game’s intensity increased with the occasional push and shove that drew a couple of yellow cards to both sides. Blue Kumuls Inia occasionally tried using wide balls but was cut off by the defence of Nathan Togs and his company of youthful defenders for Genesis. Three minutes to half-time Genesis number 4, Stanley Kila picked up a missed ball by a Blue Kumuls defender only to miss what could have been the easiest of goals. Genesis came back in the second half all fired up with right winger Kaniyosi making his usual runs let loose a shot that hit the left post much to the delight of the supporters on the sidelines. Midfielders led by Benjamin Kila continued with their threatening runs into Blue Kumuls territory but the strikers time and again could not find the mark with their shots. Number 16 Vela made several attempts at goal but most were wide also. Niebo and Ara also made attempts for Genesis without much success. Ten minutes later a clearance header from a corner to Steven Inia found henchman Tapio who shot unchallenged from the edge of the box to just tip the crossbar. That miss brought deafening sighs to the Blue Kumuls supporters. Inia continued with his through balls when a pass landed in front of teammate Steven Giwibing (2) who fumbled right in the box much to the dismay of the sighing supporters. A minute to time Steven Inia was assisted off-field with an injury with the scores remaining at one all until full-time. Marty Terry of Blue Kumuls commented saying: “ We had our chances but could not finish off well. “And yes both teams played well also’’ Genesis’s Emmanuel Liosi said: “Blue Kumuls is a respected team in the premier division and when you play them you take them seriously. “Yes our youthful team did their best but we did miss a lot of chances also.”

title: Hunt for two men after double assault in Carnoustie leaves man in hospital
creator: Matthew Fulton
description: A 23-year-old was taken to Ninewells Hospital in Dundee to be treated for serious injuries.
content: Officers said two men, aged 23 and 30, were assaulted at around 12.30am in Carnoustie on Saturday, May 25 by two other men on Ferrier Street with the junction of Dundee Street. The 23-year-old was taken to Ninewells Hospital in Dundee to be treated for serious injuries, while the 30-year-old did not require medical treatment. Police are searching for two men, one of whom is described as in his late teens to early 20s, wearing a dark long sleeve top, grey trousers and white trainers. The second man is described as in his late teens to early 20s, of slim build, with short dark hair shaved at the sides, wearing a black T-shirt, black shorts, white socks and grey/black Nike trainers. Detective Constable Euan Mitchell of CID said: “This assault left one of the victims with serious injuries. “We know the area was busy at the time and I am asking anyone who witnessed the assault and has not already spoken to police to contact us. “If you believe you could help our enquiries, call quoting reference 0151 of May 25, 2024. “Alternatively, you can call Crimestoppers on , if you wish to remain anonymous.” Get all the latest news from around the country Scan the QR code on your mobile device for all the latest news from around the country

title: H M issues Royal Decree
keywords: his majesty sultan haitham bin tarik
creator: Mohammad
description: His Majesty Sultan Haitham bin Tarik issued Royal Decree No 27/2024 on Monday transferring ‘Oman Centre for Traditional Music’ from the Diwan of Royal Court to the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Youth
content: His Majesty Sultan Haitham bin Tarik issued Royal Decree No 27/2024 on Monday transferring ‘Oman Centre for Traditional Music’ from the Diwan of Royal Court to the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Youth. states that Oman Centre for Traditional Music shall be transferred from the Diwan of Royal Court to the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Youth. stipulates that all allocations, properties, origins, rights, obligations and assets of Oman Centre for Traditional Music (Diwan of Royal Court) shall be transferred to the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Youth. states that employees of Oman Centre for Traditional Music shall be transferred to the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Youth, along with their financial grades. cancels all that contradicts this decree or contravenes its provisions. says that this decree shall be published in the Official Gazette and enforced from its date of issue.

title: 'Did they think you were setting up a halting site?' - Man fumes on RTÉ radio as council take caravan
creator: Jasmin Griffin
description: A 71-year-old security guard, William Brown, was shocked to discover his caravan, purchased a month prior, was missing from his property after returning from his early morning shift. Speaking to Joe Duffy on RTÉ's Liveline, William, who starts work in Dublin at 5am, was informed one morning last wee
content: The caravan, which Mr Browne admits he acquired for €1,600 just four weeks ago, was to be intended as a cost-effective alternative to B&Bs and hotels Reporter: Reporter 27 May 2024 7:15 PM A 71-year-old security guard, William Browne, was shocked to discover his caravan, purchased a month prior, was missing from his property after returning from his early morning shift. Speaking to Joe Duffy on RTÉ's Liveline, William, who starts work in Dublin at 5am, was informed one morning last week by his daughter at approximately 10am that the caravan had been taken. It was confirmed that South Dublin County Council's Environmental team removed the caravan following several complaints from local residents. The caravan, which William admits he acquired for €1,600 just four weeks ago, was to be intended as a cost-effective alternative to B&Bs and hotels. Originally from Wexford, now living in Clondalkin, he said that he had planned to use the caravan for visits home, especially during summer when relatives come to visit. Despite words from council staff that the caravan was not an issue as long as it was unoccupied, William was surprised by the action taken against him. It is said that a notice citing the Housing Miscellaneous Provisions Act required him to remove the "temporary dwelling" within one day, with warnings of a €1,270 fine. The caravan, which they joked was something from 'Father Ted,' was on a grassy spot until it was seized. "There's an patch of grass, westbound, at the side of my house and there's surveillance there on the wall, and that's where the carvan was," said William. Later, Joe responded: " What did they think you were doing? Setting up a halting site or something." After calling the council's environmental office after receiving a letter regarding the caravan, William received no answer so took to visit the Tallaght-based office. It said that the situation remains unresolved, and the caravan is still seized. William, who also owns a small boat and a jeep which can pull the caravan, was disappointed over the council’s actions. Given previous health struggles which he detailed on the show, including past heart surgery, a stroke, diabetes, and chronic asthma, William told Joe of his worries on his health regarding the stress of the ordeal. South Dublin County Council have been contacted for comment on the matter, but had not replied at time of publication.

title: Katie Price shares savage post about 'narcissistic people' after Carl Woods split
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Zara Woodcock)
description: Former glamour model Katie Price and ex-fiancé Carl Woods split up last year. Katie recently shared a new post about 'five reasons the narcissist hates you'
content: Katie Price shared a post detailing 'five reasons the narcissist hates you' months after her split from Carl Woods. The former glamour model, who is currently dating Married At First Sight UK star JJ Slater, was previously engaged to Love Island star Carl. The duo were in an on-ff relationship since they first started dating in 2020. They were believed to have split up again in November last year but sparked reconciliation rumours the following month when they were seen together . Not long after, Katie was seen enjoying cosy nights out with JJ before confirming their relationship on social media. Katie, who doesn't shy away from sharing cryptic posts about her exes, recently took to her social media to share a post about narcissism on her Stories. The post read: "Five reasons the narcissist hates you: 1. You've stopped falling for their lies 2. They've lost the control they once had over you 3. You've cracked their facade and see them for who they really are 4. You're no longer desperate for their approval 5. Their schemes and tricks don't work on you anymore." Katie shared a new post about narcissism on her page ( Image: Instagram/ @katieprice) The duo, who were in an on-off relationship for a few years, split last year ( Image: Getty Images) Back in February, Carl made a few digs about the split as he praised himself for getting himself through the tough period. Carl vowed to keep a 'low profile' and focus on himself after the breakup. Taking to his Instagram stories, the former Love Island star made a number of digs at his ex-fiancée. In one story post, Carl showed off his adorable new puppy as he joked that his new pet pooch was 'doing his head in'. However, he also commended his dog's immense 'loyalty' as he said it was the 'most important thing'. In another story, Carl re-shared an inspirational video which said: "God knows when to send you exactly what you need. Being private, staying low-key, and not telling everyone everything is self-care. Seek respect, not attention." Carl then appeared to reference his split with Katie as he re-shared yet another inspirational video. "I love you enough to let you go," the video started. "Go find that person that you say is better than me. Everything hurts when you love somebody. I love for real." Meanwhile, Carl and Katie's other ex Kieran Hayler united at Silver Leas Polo in Hertfordshire and looked all smiles as they shared a video of their outing on social media. However, one of their mutual pals present couldn't help but point out the meeting was "awkward", while jokingly putting a hand to their mouth as the camera panned around. This isn't the first time Kieran and Carl spend time together as they previously celebrated Easter Sunday as a duo - which allegedly left their famous ex furious. title: Lionel Messi's annual salary at Inter Miami not too much?
description: Lionel Messi's Inter Miami salary is now revealed. — Reuters/FileLionel Messi’s annual salary he receives from Inter Miami has been revealed by the press sources. Lionel Messi gets $20.45 million annual net salary from Inter Miami, making him the highest paid player in the American...
content: Lionel Messi’s annual salary he receives from Inter Miami has been revealed by the press sources. Lionel Messi gets $20.45 million annual net salary from Inter Miami, making him the highest paid player in the American League, according to The Guardian . This is ahead of the whole clubs which do not pay this much amount to their full-player rosters. With $12 million as a basic salary, in addition to various bonuses, the Argentine player joined Inter Miami. As Messi earned 138 million euros in one season during his last contract with Barcelona in 2017, the Argentine player’s salary at Inter Miami does not appear to be the best in his football career. Messi’s Barcelona salary had a value that included more salaries and bonuses before he moved to Paris Saint-Germain in 2021. With a contract extending until the end of 2025, Lionel Messi became part of Inter Miami in July of last year. Moreover, he rejected the idea of ​​​​leaving for the Saudi League, after receiving an astronomical offer from Crescent Moon.
